critique: This document suspends certain employment regulations in the Canal Zone during wartime. It's difficult to assess its ideological tilt without more context, but it seems related to wartime efficiency. Immigration is not directly addressed. Executive power is expanded temporarily to suspend regulations. Federalism is somewhat implicated as it concerns federal control over the Canal Zone. National security is likely prioritized due to the wartime context. Economic regulation is temporarily relaxed. Social inclusion is not directly addressed.
